pride.translation[0].definitions[0].defi: a feeling that you are proud of something that you or someone connected with you has achieved
pride.translation[0].definitions[0].exam: He wore his medals with pride.
His heart swelled with pride when his daughter came in.
She felt a glow of pride when her name was announced for the prize.
Success in sport is a source of national pride.
He takes great pride in his children’s achievements.
The people have a sense of pride in their community.
pride.translation[0].definitions[1].defi: a feeling that you like and respect yourself and that you deserve to be respected by other people
pride.translation[0].definitions[1].exam: I think that getting a job would give him his pride back.
She didn’t try to hide her anger and injured pride.
It’s a matter of pride for some men that their wives don’t have to work.
It hurt his pride when his wife left him.
pride.translation[0].definitions[2].defi: a belief that you are better than other people and do not need their help or support
pride.translation[0].definitions[2].exam: She ought to swallow her pride (=ignore or forget her feelings of pride) and call him.
His pride wouldn’t allow him to ask for help.
pride.translation[0].definitions[3].exam: A young lion had strayed some distance from the pride.
